job_title: Campus Tour Guide in New York, NY
pros: Enjoy meeting new people and walk around campus!

review_title: Decent job, management needs to prioritize better.
job_title: Security Officer in New York, NY
pros: Decent, easy job, lots of overtime available. Steady and high job security is there if you come and and simply do your job everyday, nothing complicated. However, JTS upper management needs to listen and prioritize tending to the concerns and needs of the department-As they seem nonchalant, careless and out of touch.Upping the pay scale to compete with affiliate schools would go long way to decrease high turnover ratio in line with workload, up morale across the board, And motivate people to stay. My advice currently would be to use this position as a stepping-stone towards something greater.
cons: Out of touch upper management. Pay scale.

job_title: Library Assistant in New York, NY
pros: Access to amazing books and manuscripts
cons: Poor pay, take you for granted, no professional advancement

job_title: Security Officer in New York, NY
pros: Overtime is good, co workers good
cons: Harsh work environment not worth working here

pros: 4 day work week; Jewish holidays off; Excellent medical coverage at a very reasonable rate
cons: Siloed departments; No attention/effort paid to employee retention; Extremely low salaries; Incompetent HR dept; high attrition; no pathway to advancement.

job_title: Security Guard in New York, NY
pros: You can make as much overtime as needed
cons: You will get stuck on doubles very often and will sometimes find out 30 mins before thinking your going home.

job_title: Human Resources Coordinator in New York, NY
pros: Friendly people to work with, 4 day work week, good mission
cons: Low pay for expected output, no upward movement possible

job_title: Executive Assistant in New York, NY
pros: The people are great and so nice
cons: The compensation is extremely low for the work given to you

job_title: Adjunct Faculty in New York, NY
pros: Some wonderful individuals. Can sometimes work remotely.
cons: No sense of mission or community building. Hierarchy impedes growth. Salaries are low.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in New York, NY
cons: Women get paid less than men. There have been only 2 COLA raises in the last 8 years. There's money for lots of things but not keeping employees current. benefits are sub-par, the leadership is disconnected and supervision is almost non-existent. You never know if your work is valued by the Dean. Emails from HR and others aren't answered so it feels like there is no where to turn for help.

review_title: Most Mismanaged Institution I’ve Ever Worked For
job_title: Faculty Center Office Manager in New York, NY
pros:
-Off on Fridays and all Jewish Holidays
-Holiday Break
-Sweet Colleagues
-Affordable Healthcare
cons:
If you are young in your career, looking to advance in your career, looking to make more money, or looking to provide substantial improvement at an organization - avoid at all costs. 

I’ve worked for countless for and non-profits, including Jewish organizations and have never seen such a disaster of a company. I could go on, but I would just say to avoid unless you are looking for a low paying job before you retire.

review_title: The center of Jewish education, arts, history, leadershiip and vision in North America. The center of it all!"
pros: The best part of being at JTS are the students, faculty, volunteers, and community are the best and the brightest and will shape the future and relevancy of Judaism for generations. It is the most exciting place to be, with the 7th Chancellor, and new vision for leadership, learning, Torah, and brings Jewish history and texts to be relevent today. The support of staff, employee assistance program, benefits, and overall vibe are excellent.
cons: Parking is a problem, expensive and mass transit it less than optimal when commuting from the boroughs.

review_title: Great opportunity - unfortunately JTS fell flat
job_title: Anonymous Employee in New York, NY
pros: JTS is a great school with excellent academic programs, so selling the school to prospective students is fairly easy. There are a lot of full time employees, so there are a lot of different job opportunities. In my position, I have the opportunity to travel, which is one of my favorite parts of the job.
cons:
This position reports to 3-4 different people in each of the schools as well as the admissions department. That is challenging for anyone, but the supervisors are all challenging as individuals as well. As supervisors, they are very top down and there are no mentoring opportunities as an employee. Each supervisor works in a silo, so there is no collaboration between departments and the person in this position is expected to report to each supervisor with no cross over between tasks and departments. 

The on-boarding at JTS was terrible. Aside from the training in the admissions department which lasted a week and wasn't incredibly helpful, there was no ongoing support for learning how to do this job. There was no general HR on-boarding with regards to company policies and procedures. HR was not forth coming with information regarding medical/dental/transit check/retirement/everything else HR manages. 

Finally, while JTS is a wonderful community for the students, for the staff it is very cold. It isn't social in any way, shape or form. I have been working here for almost a year and there are still tons of people I've never met and departments I haven't seen. 

They also didn't negotiate in anything - salary, vacation time, health insurance, etc.

review_title: Only good for recent college grads or ending your career
job_title: Administrative Assistant in New York, NY
pros: - Good for work/life balance in that you have a plethora of days off (Jewish Holidays, Fridays, and National Holidays) depending on department
cons:
- Work Culture is non-existent. High turnover rate, lack of support and community has lead to poor morale
- Lack of opportunities. No performance evaluations and therefore no promotions, raises or bonuses. Your salary will only change with 2% COLA's which are only approved through the board. And you are more likely to get an increase in work or move between departments because of lack of staff.

review_title: Good Place for a College Grad
job_title: Administrative Assistant in New York, NY
pros:
-Fridays and weekends off
-Jewish Holidays off with pay
-Sense of Community when a bereavement or celebration occurs
cons:
-No salary increase
-No bonuses
-No growth unless you're faculty

job_title: Administrative Assistant in New York, NY
pros: Learning more about the Jewish culture. Having Sabbaths off. Getting off early on Fridays in the winter months. Great health benefits.
cons: Not much room for growth; especially if you are not a Jewish male.

job_title: Human Resources Generalist in New York, NY
pros: It was exciting to be a part of a community that was so ambitious and far reaching.  Great 4 day work week, and a lot of PTO holidays.
cons: Some departments were difficult to work with and caused for a lot of turnover.

pros:
* Jewish and regular holidays off for many employees
